definition: to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Both men froze when they saw it was the Duke of Sui himself telling them to stop!
sentences.chinese: 两个人一看到是隋侯爷叫他们住手，马上停手了。

sentences.english: But he taps and strokes it until it finally relaxes and stretches.
sentences.chinese: 可他还是把这只海葵打到松懈下来才住手。

sentences.english: He won't stop until he finishes the job.
You can even use latex gloves to cover your hands.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以使用乳胶手套护住手。
“住手，”我不假思索的朝它吼道。

sentences.english: We'll be bound hand and foot it we sign that paper.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们在那文件上签字，我们就会被完全捆住手脚。

sentences.english: Stop, put me down. Get your hands off me. What are you doing?
sentences.chinese: 住手，放我下来，拿开你的手，你们在干嘛？

definition: to shout at sb to stop
(of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to shout an order or command
to wait a moment/do not go too soon
to get out of the way
to boil (of liquid)/boiling hot/Get out!/Go away!/fuck off (rude)
